english: Someone who cries in the house, will also cry at the door, it's the same thing.
creole: A body wah cry a-house, an'a body wah cry a-doo', a same t'ing

english: Someone they don't want to roast, nor sit down near the fire.
creole: A body wah dem no wan' fo' roas', no fo' si' down carnah fiah

english: The colony hare has strong teeth; that's why he eats the seed of the awarra palm.
creole: Accouri know he teet' 'trang; da mek he eat banga

english: The colony hare took the alligator's teeth and made sugar cake.
creole: Accouri tek cayman teet' he mek sugah cake

english: I came for a milking cow, not to count cattle.
creole: A come fo' milk cow, no fo' reckon cattle

english: A cow that cries for water and he wants it
creole: A cow wah cry fo' watah na he a-want am

english: The dog has the freedom to watch the governor.
creole: A daag hab libaty fo' watch a-de gubnah

english: A dog's mouth makes it unable to climb a tree.
creole: A daag mout' mek he can't climb tree

english: A white person died of yellow fever today.
creole: A gold mek Bacra a dead wid yalla febah t'day
